revised_title: Analyzing Sail Stability and Luffing Phenomena
tldr: This article presents an approximate theory that predicts the threshold of stability in a simple sail, focusing on the luffing phenomenon. It discusses the conditions necessary for a sail to adopt a symmetrical profile with constant curvature and examines the lift distribution, equilibrium, and stability of a sail under tension. The theory is applicable to flexible two-dimensional sails and ideal fluids with free stream pressure.
